Artist.Name: Vincent Van Gogh
Artist.Description: Vincent Willem van Gogh was a Dutch Post-Impressionist painter who is among the most famous and influential figures in the history of Western art.
Artist.Famous: Sunflowers (F.458), repetition of the 4th version (yellow background)

Artist.Name: Pablo Picasso
Artist.Description: Pablo Picasso was a Spanish painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet and playwright who spent most of his adult life in France

Artist.Name: Claude Monet
Artist.Description: Oscar-Claude Monet was a founder of French Impressionist painting, and the most consistent and prolific practitioner of the movement's philosophy of expressing one's perceptions before nature, especially as applied to plein-air landscape painting.

Artist.Name: Leonardo da Vinci
Artist.Description: Leonardo di ser Piero da Vinci more commonly Leonardo da Vinci or simply Leonardo, was an Italian Renaissance polymath

Artist.Name: Michelangelo
Artist.Description: Michelangelo di Lodovico Buonarroti Simoni or more commonly known by his first name Michelangelo was an Italian sculptor, painter, architect and poet of the High Renaissance.

ArtWork.Name: The Starry Night
ArtWork.Description: The Starry Night is an oil on canvas by the Dutch post-impressionist painter Vincent van Gogh.
ArtWork.Type: Ultramarine, cobalt blue, indian yellow and zinc yellow

ArtWork.Name: Mona Lisa
ArtWork.Description: The Mona Lisa is a half-length portrait painting by the Italian Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci.

ArtWork.Name: Guernica
ArtWork.Description: Guernica is a mural-sized oil painting on canvas by Spanish artist Pablo Picasso completed in June 1937, at his home on Rue des Grands Augustins, in Paris.
ArtWork.Location: Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía

ArtWork.Name: The Last Supper
ArtWork.Description: The Last Supper is a late 15th-century mural painting by Leonardo da Vinci housed by the refectory of the Convent of Santa Maria delle Grazie in Milan.

ArtWork.Name: Sistine Chapel Ceiling
ArtWork.Description: The Sistine Chapel ceiling, painted by Michelangelo between 1508 and 1512, is a cornerstone work of High Renaissance art.

Museum.Name: The Acropolis Museum
Museum.History: The monuments of the Acropolis have withstood the ravages of past centuries, both of ancient times and those of the Middle Ages. Until the 17th century, foreign travellers visiting the monuments depicted the classical buildings as being intact.
Museum.ArtWorks: Artefacts from the Athenian Acropolis, the most significant sanctuary of the ancient city
Museum.Description: The Acropolis Museum is an archaeological museum focused on the findings of the archaeological site of the Acropolis of Athens.

Museum.Name: Le Louvre Museum
Museum.History: The history of the Louvre begins around 1190 with Philippe Auguste’s decision to erect a fortified enclosure to protect Paris. This was an important gesture in favor of urbanism and a display of the king’s authority just as he was preparing to leave the country to go to war in the Crusades>
Museum.ArtWorks: Mona Lisa, St. John the Baptist, Virgin of the Rocks
Museum.Description: The Louvre Palace is a former royal palace located on the Right Bank of the Seine in Paris, between the Tuileries Gardens and the church of Saint-Germain l'Auxerrois.

Museum.Name: State Hermitage Museum
Museum.People: Director: Mikhail Piotrovsky, Founder: Catherine the Great
Museum.History: Located between the Neva River and Palace Square, the Hermitage Museum complex consists of five buildings—Winter Palace, Large Hermitage, Small Hermitage, New Hermitage, and the Theatre of Catherine the Great. Each of the buildings was designed by celebrated architects from the 18th and 19th centuries.
Museum.ArtWorks: The Return of the Prodigal Son, Judith Giorgione, Flora Rembrandt
Museum.Description: The State Hermitage Museum is a museum of art and culture in Saint Petersburg, Russia.

Museum.Name: The British Museum
Museum.Location: Great Russell St, Bloomsbury, London WC1B 3DG, UK
Museum.History: Although today principally a museum of cultural art objects and antiquities, the British Museum was founded as a 'universal museum'. Its foundations lie in the will of the Irish-born British physician and naturalist Sir Hans Sloane (1660–1753).
Museum.ArtWorks: Rosetta Stone, Study for Adam, Rosetta Stone
Museum.Description: Its permanent collection numbers some 8 million works, and is among the largest and most comprehensive in existence

Museum.Name: The Prado
Museum.Location: Paseo del Prado, s/n, 28014 Madrid, Spain
Museum.People: Architects: Rafael Moneo, Juan de Villanueva
Museum.History: The building that today houses the Museo Nacional del Prado was designed by architect Juan de Villanueva in 1785. It was constructed to house the Natural History Cabinet, by orders of King Charles III.
Museum.ArtWorks: The Third of May 1808, Ka maja desnuda, Las Hilanderas
Museum.Description: The Prado Museum is the main Spanish national art museum, located in central Madrid.
